alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 12:18PM EDT until July 17 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Oxford, Cumberland and Carroll Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters surround properties across Transvale Acres. Flood waters 1 to 2 feet deep in sections of east bank camping areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
